result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kyle E. Berschneider

records.addlTxt:
2:20 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Kyle E. Berschneider.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls all cases and appearances. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Agreement reached-Set for plea hearing. Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

2:58 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Kyle E. Berschneider.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case-Victim is running late-adjourn for time for the victim to appear. Back on the record at 3:03 PM. Court recalls case. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. No objections from the State. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 02:20 pm.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 02:20 pm.

8:57 AM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Alysja Otten in court for Kyle E. Berschneider. Court calls case and appearances. Defendant waives his right to appear in person. Waived reading of the Information. Not guilty plea is entered. Bond to continue. Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:55 pm.
Status conference on September 12, 2022 at 02:55 pm.

9:31 AM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Kyle E. Berschneider. Court calls case and appearances.  Court questions the defendant re: his right to appear in person. Court finds the defendant waives his right to a personal appearance. State calls Deputy Drew Knoop to the stand. Clerk swears in. State begins questioning. Court finds the witness has identified the defendant. Nothing futher. Cross from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Nothing further. No redirect-Witness excused. Argument. Court finds probable cause. Bond to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:50 am.
